{"step_by_step_thinking": "A patient with lactose intolerance is unable to digest lactose, a sugar found in milk. Therefore, it is recommended to avoid consuming products that contain lactose, such as condensed milk, ice-cream, and skimmed milk. Yogurt, on the other hand, can be tolerated by some individuals with lactose intolerance due to its lower lactose content and the presence of live cultures that can help break down lactose.", "answer_choice": "D"}
